meanings.definition: To divide or distribute in advance into specific portions.
meanings.sent1: She carefully preportioned the snacks for the party.
meanings.sent2: The chef preportioned the ingredients before starting to cook.
meanings.sent3: The squirrel preportioned the nuts in its stash for the winter.
meanings.sent4: The teacher preportioned the assignments to ensure fairness.
meanings.sent5: Preportioning the paint into small containers made the task easier.

meanings.definition: The act of determining or setting aside specific amounts or portions beforehand.
meanings.sent1: The preportioning of the budget helped avoid overspending.
meanings.sent2: Proper preportioning of resources is crucial for project success.
meanings.sent3: The preportioning of candy at the store made the kids excited.
meanings.sent4: The preportioning of time for each task kept the schedule on track.
meanings.sent5: The preportioning of ingredients in the recipe made cooking a breeze.
